metadata.title: Landing Page Information Architecture and Multi-Tenant Positioning Copy Spec
metadata.prd_reference: Product positioning implied by PRD modules (booking, patients, billing, analytics, RBAC, tenant isolation) + user UI pillars

context.background: This task converts benchmark findings into a concrete Healio landing page content/IA specification. It should produce implementation-ready section copy and messaging priorities tailored to a multi-tenant clinic SaaS with multiple users/roles (owner, doctor, receptionist) and future scale.

design_constraints.constraint: Messaging must feel trustworthy, operationally concrete, and not generic AI/SaaS marketing filler.
Landing page copy should clearly communicate multi-tenant/multi-user support and role-based workflows without overpromising unsupported features.
Structure should support a high-conversion flow: problem framing → product value → role/workflow proof → trust/security/tenant isolation → feature depth → CTA.
Copy and IA should map to real implemented routes/features where possible (public booking, patients, appointments, billing, analytics, settings, audit logs).

instruction.step: Create `healio/docs/marketing/landing-page-content-spec.md` with an implementation-ready section-by-section content outline for the new landing page.
Define hero messaging, subhead, primary/secondary CTAs, and supporting proof points for a clinic owner audience while still addressing doctors and front-desk staff.

Specify a section for multi-tenant/multi-role architecture value (clinic isolation, role-aware access, centralized operations, audit/security posture) using accurate claims based on implemented modules.
Draft concise content for major sections (feature cards, workflows, social proof placeholders, integration trust band, FAQ, final CTA, footer navigation labels).
Include a content-to-component mapping plan (which sections should be reusable components in `components/marketing/*` vs inline in `app/page.tsx`).

validation_checklist.check: Hero and CTA copy are specific to clinic operations and do not read like a generic software template.
IA includes explicit multi-tenant / multi-user value communication tied to real features (RBAC, audit, clinic-scoped data, role workflows).
Copy references implemented feature areas accurately (no unsupported integrations or functionality claims).
The spec is detailed enough that the UI implementation task can be executed with minimal rethinking.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: `healio/docs/marketing/landing-page-content-spec.md` exists with a complete section sequence and draft copy for the landing page.
The content spec clearly articulates Healio’s multi-tenant and multi-role positioning in accurate, non-generic terms.
The spec includes CTA strategy, section hierarchy, and componentization guidance for `components/marketing/*`.
The content remains aligned with existing implemented features and the PRD/user design direction.
